div.h2: ILLINOIS SCHOOLS ARE NOW CLOSED THROUGH THE END OF THE SCHOOL YEAR .

h2.a: REMOTE LEARNING PLANS BY BUILDING (Updated through 4/20-4/24)

img.alt: Update, Friday, April 3, Remote Learning Plan

a.span: Update, Friday, April 3, Remote Learning Plan

div.p:
Friday, April 3, 2020
Marshall Schools Community,
I hope all are doing well. I have a few updates to share as promised.
Remote Learning Plan
On Monday,...
To the Class of 2020, With the Governors School Closure announcement today, our hearts go out to all students, families, and the Community with regards to experiences...

Marshall Schools Community,
I hope all continue to be safe and healthy.
As we near the end of Week 2 of Remote Learning Days and Week 5 of the School Closure, I...

p.a: Event: *Last Day for Students, Early Dismissal

div.p: Please see the link below for a Message to the Class of 2020

Governor Pritzker has extended the School Closure through the end of the School Year. Remote Learning will continue during this time. Meal pick-up and delivery will continue as well. More updates will be provided next week. Thank you for your patience and cooperation.

MHS will join many IHSA Schools in "Lights For The Fight" to honor the Class of 2020, healthcare workers, first responders, and all other essential workers on the front lines of the pandemic.
Click for more info

Please see the website News or follow the link below for an April 16 Update from Superintendent Ross on some Frequently Asked Questions.
https://www.marshallk12.net/article/232772?org=marshall-community-school-district-c2
Happy Monday! Reminder that lunch pick-up and delivery resumes today, Monday, April 13. Thanks to our cooks, bus drivers, teacher aides, and volunteers for all their work to make this happen!
